contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=May 2007}} {{Infobox Ottoman sultan |Sultan_Name=Suleiman II |image_portrait=Süleyman II.jpg |image_tugra=Tughra of Suleiman II.JPG |Military=Stagnation of the Ottoman Empire |title=[[Ottoman Caliphate|Caliph of Islam]]<br />[[List of sultans of the Ottoman Empire|Ottoman Sultan]] |before=[[Mehmed IV]] |after=[[Ahmed II]] |years=November 8, 1687 – June 22, 1691 |father=[[Ibrahim of the Ottoman Empire|Ibrahim]] |mother=[[Saliha Dilaşub Sultan]] }} '''Suleiman II''' (April 15, 1642 – June 22/23 1691) ([[Ottoman Turkish language|Ottoman Turkish]]: سليمان ثانى ''Süleymān-i <u>s</u>ānī'') was the [[Sultan]] of the [[Ottoman Empire]] from 1687 to 1691. ==Early life== The younger brother of [[Mehmed IV]] (1648–87), Suleiman II was born at [[Topkapı Palace]] in [[Constantinople]] and had spent most of his life in the ''[[kafes]]'' (cage), a kind of luxurious prison for princes of the blood within the [[Topkapı Palace]] (it was designed to ensure that none could organize a rebellion). His mother was a Serbian girl named Katarina<ref>Ali Kemal Meram, ''Padişah Anaları: Resimli Belgesel Tarih Romanı, Öz Yayınları, 1977, [http://books.google.com/books?id=rgkG57W9t0MC&q=Saliha+Dil%C3%A2%C5%9Fub+Sultan+s%C4%B1rp&dq=Saliha+Dil%C3%A2%C5%9Fub+Sultan+s%C4%B1rp&hl=en&ei=gBDpTbXLJo2EvAOyotC8Dw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CCwQ6AEwAQ p. 325.]</ref> [[Saliha Dilâşub Sultan]]. ==Reign== ===Ottoman–Habsburg War=== [[File:Battle of Mohács 1687.jpg|thumb|The [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman Army]] after suffering a devastating defeat during the [[Battle of Mohács (1687)|Second Battle of Mohács]].]] Immediately after assuming the throne, the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]] suffered a devastating defeat at [[Battle of Mohács (1687)|the second Battle of Mohács]]. Unable to rule effectively himself, Suleiman II shrewdly appointed [[Köprülü Fazıl Mustafa Pasha]] as his [[Grand Vizier]]. Even so, when [[Russia]] joined an alliance of European powers, the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]] suffered the devastating [[Crimean campaigns]]. Under Köprülü's leadership the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]] halted an [[Austria]]n advance into [[Serbia]] and crushed an uprising in [[Bulgaria]] until [[Köprülü Fazıl Mustafa Pasha]] was killed in the [[Battle of Slankamen]] by Austrian forces. Suleiman II died at [[Edirne]] Palace in 1691. He married Khadija, but died without issue. ===Relations with the Mughal Empire=== In the year 1688 the desperate [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] Sultan Suleiman II urgently requested for assistance against the rapidly advancing [[Habsburg Monarchy|Austrians]], during the [[Great Turkish War|Ottoman–Habsburg War]] however the [[Mughal Emperor]] [[Aurangzeb]] and his forces were heavily engaged in the ''Deccan Wars'' against the [[Marathas]] to commit any formal assistance to their desperate Ottoman allies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=uB1uAAAAMAAJ&q=suleiman+ii#search_anchor |title=Mughal-Ottoman relations: a study of political & diplomatic relations ... - Naimur Rahman Farooqi - Google Boeken |publisher=Books.google.com |date= |accessdate=29 April 2012}}</ref> ==See also== *[[Ottoman Empire]] *[[Mughal Empire]] == Sources == {{reflist}} <BR> {{s-start}} {{s-hou|[[Ottoman Dynasty|House of Osman]]||April 15, 1642||June 22, 1691}}[aged 49] {{s-reg|}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mehmed IV]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of sultans of the Ottoman Empire|Sultan of the Ottoman Empire]]|years=Nov 8, 1687 – Jun 22, 1691}} {{s-aft|after=[[Ahmed II]]}} {{s-rel|su}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mehmed IV]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of caliphs|Caliph of Islam]]|years=Nov 8, 1687 – Jun 22, 1691}} {{s-aft|after=[[Ahmed II]]}} {{end}} {{Sultans of the Ottoman Empire}} {{Commons category|Suleiman II}} {{Persondata |name=Suleiman II |alternative names= |short description= Ottoman Sultan |date of birth=April 15, 1642 |place of birth= |date of death= 1691 |place of death= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Suleiman Ii}} [[Category:1642 births]] [[Category:1691 deaths]] [[Category:People from Istanbul]] [[Category:Ottoman people of the Great Turkish War]] [[Category:17th-century Ottoman sultans]] [[Category:Ottoman people of Serbian descent]]
